Sentencas: This work assesses the feasibility of Solid Oxide Fuel Cell-Gas Turbine (SOFC-GT) hybrid power systems for use as the prime mover in freight locomotives.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: The available space in a diesel engine-powered locomotive is compared to that required for an SOFC-GT system, inclusive of fuel processing systems necessary for the SOFC-GT.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: The SOFC-GT space requirement is found to be similar to current diesel engines, without consideration of the electrical balance of plant.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: Preliminary design of the system layout within the locomotive is carried out for illustration.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: Recent advances in SOFC technology and implications of future improvements are discussed as well.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: A previously-developed FORTRAN model of an SOFC-GT system is then augmented to simulate the kinematics and power notching of a train and its locomotives.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: The operation of the SOFC-GT-powered train is investigated along a representative route in Southern California, with simulations presented for diesel reformate as well as natural gas reformate and hydrogen as fuels.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: Operational parameters and difficulties are explored as are comparisons of expected system performance to modern diesel engines.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation

Sentencas: It is found that even in the diesel case, the SOFC-GT system provides significant savings in fuel and CO2 emissions, making it an attractive option for the rail industry.
Titulo: Feasibility study for SOFC-GT hybrid locomotive power part II. System packaging and operating route simulation
